title: Go Backend Unit Tests - Services
problem: The Go backend services contain critical business logic that must be thoroughly tested to ensure correctness, prevent regressions, and enable safe refactoring. Without comprehensive service layer tests, bugs in business logic may go undetected and changes to the codebase become risky.
success_metrics: All service methods have corresponding unit tests
Mock-based testing isolates services from dependencies
Edge cases and error scenarios are covered
non_goals: Integration with real database (covered in Milestone 5.6)

items.title: PostService Unit Tests
items.description: Comprehensive unit tests for PostService covering all business logic methods with mocked repository dependencies.

items.title: CommentService Unit Tests
items.description: Unit tests for CommentService including nested comments, depth validation, and authorization.
acceptance_criteria: Test comment depth limit enforcement (max 5 levels)

items.title: ReactionService Unit Tests
items.description: Unit tests for ReactionService covering reaction types, toggle behavior, and count aggregations.
acceptance_criteria: Test React with all valid types (like, love, laugh, wow, sad, angry)

items.title: FollowService Unit Tests
items.description: Unit tests for FollowService including follow/unfollow, mutual follows, and suggestions.

items.title: UserService Unit Tests
items.description: Unit tests for UserService covering profile management, validation, and search functionality.

items.title: EmailService Unit Tests
items.description: Unit tests for EmailService covering template rendering, queue management, and error handling.
acceptance_criteria: Mock SMTP client and queue for tests
